qas.question: What hangs today over most British pub doors?
What piece of information is almost always listed on a pub sign?
What purpose do stand-alone signs serve for country pubs?

answers.text: directing potential customers to their door

context: Most British pubs still have <a0_0>decorated signs<a0_0/> hanging over their doors, and these retain their original function of enabling the identification of the pub. Today's pub signs almost always bear <a1_0>the name of the pub<a1_0/>, both in words and in pictorial representation. The more remote country pubs often have stand-alone signs <a2_0>directing potential customers to their door<a2_0/>.
